The title and story of the article indicate that the United Nations has been detected or highlighted for efforts to move the convoy into the United States. That's not true. The United Nations has provided assistance to migrants, none of which has been done in a confidential manner. In October, the Mexican Government requested United Nations assistance to respond to the needs of migrants and to immigration requests. In accordance with its humanitarian mission, the United Nations Refugee Agency sent staff to Mexico to assist the authorities in registering asylum-seekers, assisting in the accommodation of migrants, and establishing "identification and referral mechanisms for those with specific vulnerabilities and needs." The United Nations also stated that it provided legal advice and advice to people in convoys.
